bio:
Anjuli Pandavar is a Lecturer in English for Academic Purposes (EAP) at NYU Shanghai. Prior to joining NYU Shanghai, she taught at universities in Morocco, the UK and China. Anjuli holds a PhD from the University of Glasgow as well as the following teaching qualifications: CTEAP, CTEFLA and CLTHE.

Anjuli is a strong proponent of an enhanced EAP offering that also addresses the needs of faculty at English-medium universities. She teaches through experiential learning and inter-university teaching and learning collaboration. She is actively engaged in enriching the wider intellectual and artistic endeavours of the university.

Research Interests:

  • Perfecting teaching EAP through experiential learning and action research
  • Mainland Chinese students’ responses to Western academic expectations

Courses Taught:

  • EAP: It's in the News
  • EAP Seminar: Cities and Urban Consciousness

Education:

  • PhD, Political Economy, University of Glasgow, 1993
  • MPhil, Economics, University of Strathclyde, 1990
  • MA, Development Studies, University of Leeds, 1987
  • BArch, Architecture, University of Cape Town, 1984
